Well, today's "Hungry Ghost Festival." Uncles and Aunties came to our place to organize a ritual, well, shouldn't be called a ritual. Burning some incense and some papernotes; respect those descendants. "Wow.. You look prettier now, did you dye your hair...? Look like an artist...? Look fairer.." Okay, aunties and cousins like to make some joke everytime when they see us [sisters and me] "Yeah, i did.. Really...? Look nicer huh but my hair is still wavy and kind of dried...?" Hehe, greeted all of them before we had a conversation like usual; this is a manner we should learn. "Nice hair, fits your face and personality, black is dull but anyway you look prettier with your hair though it's not sleek and straight... Look nice naturally..." Cousin, Yun, a big grin. "Wow, why are you still so skinny....? You should put on weight and you will look definitely gorgeous...?" exclaimed both my aunties. I was like, "Uh... skinny...? Not again...? I'm gaining more weight now, auntie...." "Being thin" is the topic that they always like to bring up; well, i know i look thin but at least I'm better than before; unlike before, i look like an ANOREXIC. Wtf? "Auntie, my weight was 38kg before and now my weight is 42kg!" Gave them a wink. "What?! 38kg? Oh my gosh... Well, you look fine somehow. All of your sisters are skinny, even your father.. hehehe.. Well, three of you hold different kind of beauty... bla bla bla.." During this conversation, i made them laughed, you could hear they giggle and chuckle so loud; i'm a witty girl;i like to make jokes to make them laugh, want to see them happy; not because we are blood related; because i like to make them feel comfortable when they are at our place. :-) Well, aunties and cousins: thanks for all these compliments, though; but sarcastically, they crap about my weight; always do, but I know they are just joking so i don't take their words seriously. Sometimes, you may become a subject as an amusement of your families, peer, or even strangers. Keep in mind, don't get annoyed or angry easily on the 1st place; just take it easy; probably they are trying to mock you or maybe they are "advising" you in a teasing way for the sake of yours. Sometimes, those words might hurt your feeling or make you lose your dignity or hurt your pride + self esteem but think in a positive way; they might "motivate" you to be a better person. Well, i make a point of view sometimes for all the words that my family or close friends say to me and i judge myself from every angle to find weaknesses in myself. Self-improvement is good... Ignore their words or listen to them. :-) Suddenly, recalled whatever my cousin, Yun said about this thai-chinese guy, Teng. Both of us knew him when my family and her family went for a tour to Thailand. Yun was the one who had a crush on him the first place; hehe, she's always that flirtatious but eventually, Teng and I fell in love.... awww, it was the sweetest memory i had. Well, i was 15 years old that time and he was only 21 years old. Erm... *blushing* I guess he's probably 28 years old now; Introduction; Teng is a Thai who can speak fluent mandarin, he wears spectacle, fair, he looks neat all the time, humorous, mature and he's such a good looking hunk (well, a thai-chinese!); well everyone in the tour liked him... He was an assistant to a Tour Guide, Uncle David; seeking for working experience before he could become an official tour guide. Well, it was really funny when, Yun said,"Do you still remember what you said at the airport?" I stoned for a while and started to giggle and covered my mouth. Feeling embarrassed. "You said that you would pay him a visit at Thailand when you're 30 years old... and you promised that..." "Oh my, yeah i did, but not 30 years old, i mean when i'm 23 years old. It's been 7 years; he would probably get married or being a monk right now..." "Well, actually i like Teng too, hehe though i'm only a primary school student... " Bee chuckled. How did we fall in love...? Well, Bee and I were sitting at the back row in the traveler’s bus. He was sitting just behind us; we became so close when we played some games together in the bus; for example; stone, scissors, hand and other tricky games... At night, it was extremely cold; hehe, he started to disturb me by pulling my hair, feeling annoyed and tried to catch his hand but failed. In the end, i caught him and in a sudden, he just held my hand tightly, tickled my palm and i was shocked... Oh my god, i still remembered that night; Bee was sleeping beside me; and he held my hand so tight and that's all. Well, i was freaking scared that my dad would see it and my sister, heh that bugger. My face was getting hot and i could hear my heartbeats beating fast. 15 minutes of silence, but eventually i felt relaxed and feeling deeply emotional; affectionate by the touch of his palm; I'm just like China in his hand. I didn't dare to tell my siblings about this and even my cousin about it because Yun liked him that time... Only both of us knew ... we liked each other, well, we didn't hold hands whenever we went since i'm just 15 and he should know if he holds my hands, my dad would definitely kill him, just that night; holding hands, the warmth from his palm soothing me... The next 2 days before the last day, we just stared at each other; had no idea what we should do; just looking at each other lovingly and a bit awkward; he felt shy and me too. How sweet it was. He adored my brother, David so much, carried my brother everywhere since my brother was only 6 years old. Everyone likes him so much and still remembers him, even now... The day when we left Thailand, at the airport; departure; everyone started to weep; i just held my tears back from falling down my cheeks, so did he.. When we were ready for boarding; he cried, so did we; i saw his eyes were getting red and tears falling down... Even though i was very young that time, i knew this was impossible for us to continue our "relationship", though it was just a few days of being in love but it was enough for us, sweet, short and simple. I'm so lucky that he left me with a Photo, his address and a letter written "Pom Rak Khun." [I love you in Thai] "Bye..." I showed him a hand sign where i learnt from a MTV; MTV is about this girl who has an accident and she becomes mute, the only way she can express her love and "I love you" to her boyfriend is to learn hand signs, i couldn't say a word of "I love you." since my dad was rushing us but i guess he knew what did it mean. Oh well, i kept this feeling for him for two years or maybe more than that, til i reached 17... Knowing that this dream for us to get together again won't become true, just to pray that he's always safe, happy and healthy... Okay, anyway, i miss him.. All of us miss him.. He always.. Has a place in the core of my heart..
